name: Bide
description: The user spends two or three turns locked into this move and then, on the second or third turn after using this move, the user attacks the opponent, inflicting double the damage in HP it lost during those turns. This move ignores type immunity and cannot be avoided even if the target is using Dig or Fly. The user can choose to switch out during the effect. If the user switches out or is prevented from moving during this move's use, the effect ends. During the effect, if the opposing Pokemon switches out or uses Confuse Ray, Conversion, Focus Energy, Glare, Haze, Leech Seed, Light Screen, Mimic, Mist, Poison Gas, Poison Powder, Recover, Reflect, Rest, Soft-Boiled, Splash, Stun Spore, Substitute, Supersonic, Teleport, Thunder Wave, Toxic, or Transform, the previous damage dealt to the user will be added to the total.
shortDescription: Waits 2-3 turns; deals double the damage taken.

name: Bind
description: The user spends two to five turns using this move. Has a 3/8 chance to last two or three turns, and a 1/8 chance to last four or five turns. The damage calculated for the first turn is used for every other turn. The user cannot select a move and the target cannot execute a move during the effect, but both may switch out. If the user switches out, the target remains unable to execute a move during that turn. If the target switches out, the user uses this move again automatically, and if it had 0 PP at the time, it becomes 63. If the user or the target switch out, or the user is prevented from moving, the effect ends. This move can prevent the target from moving even if it has type immunity, but will not deal damage.
shortDescription: Prevents the target from moving for 2-5 turns.

name: Counter
description: Deals damage to the opposing Pokemon equal to twice the damage dealt by the last move used in the battle. This move ignores type immunity. Fails if the user moves first, or if the opposing side's last move was Counter, had 0 power, or was not Normal or Fighting type. Fails if the last move used by either side did 0 damage and was not Confuse Ray, Conversion, Focus Energy, Glare, Haze, Leech Seed, Light Screen, Mimic, Mist, Poison Gas, Poison Powder, Recover, Reflect, Rest, Soft-Boiled, Splash, Stun Spore, Substitute, Supersonic, Teleport, Thunder Wave, Toxic, or Transform.
shortDescription: If hit by Normal/Fighting move, deals 2x damage.

name: Crabhammer
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio.

name: Dig
description: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Bide, Swift, and Transform. If the user is fully paralyzed on the second turn, it continues avoiding attacks until it switches out or successfully executes the second turn of this move or Fly.
shortDescription: Digs underground turn 1, strikes turn 2.

name: Disable
description: For 0 to 7 turns, one of the target's known moves that has at least 1 PP remaining becomes disabled, at random. Fails if one of the target's moves is already disabled, or if none of the target's moves have PP remaining. If any Pokemon uses Haze, this effect ends. Whether or not this move was successful, it counts as a hit for the purposes of the opponent's use of Rage.
shortDescription: For 0-7 turns, disables one of the target's moves.

name: Haze
description: Resets the stat stages of both Pokemon to 0 and removes stat reductions due to burn and paralysis. Resets Toxic counters to 0 and removes the effect of confusion, Disable, Focus Energy, Leech Seed, Light Screen, Mist, and Reflect from both Pokemon. Removes the opponent's non-volatile status condition.
shortDescription: Resets all stat changes. Removes foe's status.

name: High Jump Kick
description: If this attack misses the target, the user takes 1 HP of crash damage. If the user has a substitute, the crash damage is dealt to the target's substitute if it has one, otherwise no crash damage is dealt.
shortDescription: User takes 1 HP of damage if it misses.

name: Leech Seed
description: At the end of each of the target's turns, The Pokemon at the user's position steals 1/16 of the target's maximum HP, rounded down and multiplied by the target's current Toxic counter if it has one, even if the target currently has less than that amount of HP remaining. If the target switches out or any Pokemon uses Haze, this effect ends. Grass-type Pokemon are immune to this move.
shortDescription: 1/8 of target's HP is restored to user every turn.

name: Light Screen
description: While the user remains active, its Special is doubled when taking damage. Critical hits ignore this effect. If any Pokemon uses Haze, this effect ends.
shortDescription: While active, user's Special is 2x when damaged.

name: Mimic
description: While the user remains active, this move is replaced by a random move known by the target, even if the user already knows that move. The copied move keeps the remaining PP for this move, regardless of the copied move's maximum PP. Whenever one PP is used for a copied move, one PP is used for this move.
shortDescription: Random move known by the target replaces this.

name: Mirror Move
description: The user uses the last move used by the target. Fails if the target has not made a move since the user switched in, or if the last move used was Mirror Move.
shortDescription: User uses the target's last used move against it.

name: Mist
description: While the user remains active, it is protected from having its stat stages lowered by other Pokemon, unless caused by the secondary effect of a move. Fails if the user already has the effect. If any Pokemon uses Haze, this effect ends.
shortDescription: While active, user is protected from stat drops.

name: Petal Dance

If the user is prevented from moving, the effect ends without causing confusion. During the effect, this move's accuracy is overwritten every turn with the current calculated accuracy including stat stage changes, but not to less than 1/256 or more than 255/256.
shortDescription: Lasts 3-4 turns. Confuses the user afterwards.

name: Substitute
description: The user takes 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, and puts it into a substitute to take its place in battle. The substitute has 1 HP plus the HP used to create it, and is removed once enough damage is inflicted on it or 255 damage is inflicted at once, or if the user switches out or faints. Until the substitute is broken, it receives damage from all attacks made by the opposing Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat stage changes caused by the opponent, unless the effect is Disable, Leech Seed, sleep, primary paralysis, or secondary confusion and the user's substitute did not break. The user still takes normal damage from status effects while behind its substitute, unless the effect is confusion damage, which is applied to the opposing Pokemon's substitute instead. If the substitute breaks during a multi-hit attack, the attack ends. Fails if the user does not have enough HP remaining to create a substitute, or if it already has a substitute. The user will create a substitute and then faint if its current HP is exactly 1/4 of its maximum HP.
shortDescription: User takes 1/4 its max HP to put in a Substitute.

name: Take Down

shortDescription: Has 1/4 recoil.

description: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.
shortDescription: 10% chance to paralyze the target.

shortDescription: Raises the user's Defense by 1.

name: Aeroblast
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio.

name: Beat Up
description: Deals typeless damage. Hits one time for each unfainted Pokemon without a non-volatile status condition in the user's party. For each hit, the damage formula uses the participating Pokemon's level, its base Attack as the Attack stat, the target's base Defense as the Defense stat, and ignores stat stages and other effects that modify Attack or Defense. Fails if no party members can participate.
shortDescription: All healthy allies aid in damaging the target.

name: Belly Drum
description: The user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down, unless the user would faint or its Attack stat stage is 6. If the user did not have enough HP, its Attack is raised by 2 stages. Otherwise, while the user's Attack stat stage is less than 6 it is raised by 2, and if its Attack stat before this step was 999 then the stat stage is lowered by 1 and the loop ends.
shortDescription: User loses 50% max HP. Maximizes Attack.

name: Bide
description: The user spends two or three turns locked into this move and then, on the second or third turn after using this move, the user attacks the opponent, inflicting double the damage in HP it lost during those turns. If the user is prevented from moving during this move's use, the effect ends. This move does not ignore type immunity.
shortDescription: Waits 2-3 turns; deals double the damage taken.

name: Counter
description: Deals damage to the opposing Pokemon equal to twice the HP lost by the user from a physical attack this turn. This move considers Hidden Power as Normal type, and only the last hit of a multi-hit attack is counted. Fails if the user moves first, if the user was not hit by a physical attack this turn, or if the user did not lose HP from the attack. If the opposing Pokemon used Fissure or Horn Drill and missed, this move deals 65535 damage.
shortDescription: If hit by physical attack, returns double damage.

name: Crabhammer
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio.

name: Cross Chop
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio.

name: Curse
description: If the user is not a Ghost type, lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage and raises the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage, unless the user's Attack and Defense stats are both at stage 6. If the user is a Ghost type, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down and even if it would cause fainting, in exchange for the target losing 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn while it is active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue to be affected. Fails if the target is already affected or has a substitute.
shortDescription: Curses if Ghost, else -1 Spe, +1 Atk, +1 Def.

name: Detect
description: The user is protected from attacks made by the opponent during this turn. This move has an X/255 chance of being successful, where X starts at 255 and halves, rounded down, each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 255 if this move fails or if the user's last move used is not Detect, Endure, or Protect. Fails if the user has a substitute or moves last this turn.
shortDescription: Prevents moves from affecting the user this turn.

name: Dig
description: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Earthquake, Fissure, and Magnitude, the user is unaffected by weather, and Earthquake and Magnitude have doubled power when used against the user.
shortDescription: Digs underground turn 1, strikes turn 2.

name: Double-Edge
description: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP. If this move hits a substitute, the recoil damage is always 1 HP.
shortDescription: Has 1/4 recoil.

name: Encore
description: For 3 to 6 turns, the target is forced to repeat its last move used. If the affected move runs out of PP, the effect ends. Fails if the target is already under this effect, if it has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, or if the move is Encore, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, or Transform.
shortDescription: The target repeats its last move for 3-6 turns.

name: Endure
description: The user will survive attacks made by the opponent during this turn with at least 1 HP. This move has an X/255 chance of being successful, where X starts at 255 and halves, rounded down, each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 255 if this move fails or if the user's last move used is not Detect, Endure, or Protect. Fails if the user has a substitute or moves last this turn.
shortDescription: User survives attacks this turn with at least 1 HP.

name: Explosion
description: The user faints after using this move. The target's Defense is halved during damage calculation.
shortDescription: Target's Def halved during damage. User faints.

name: Flail
description: The power of this move is 20 if X is 33 to 48, 40 if X is 17 to 32, 80 if X is 10 to 16, 100 if X is 5 to 9, 150 if X is 2 to 4, and 200 if X is 0 or 1, where X is equal to (user's current HP * 48 / user's maximum HP), rounded down. This move does not apply damage variance and cannot be a critical hit.
shortDescription: More power the less HP the user has left.

name: Fly
description: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Gust, Thunder, Twister, and Whirlwind, and Gust and Twister have doubled power when used against it.
shortDescription: Flies up on first turn, then strikes the next turn.

name: Focus Energy
description: Raises the user's chance for a critical hit by 1 stage. Fails if the user already has the effect. Baton Pass can be used to transfer this effect to an ally.
shortDescription: Raises the user's critical hit ratio by 1.

name: Foresight
description: As long as the target remains active, if its evasiveness stat stage is greater than the attacker's accuracy stat stage, both are ignored during accuracy checks, and Normal- and Fighting-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Ghost type. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain under this effect. Fails if the target is already affected.
shortDescription: Fighting, Normal hit Ghost. Evasiveness ignored.

name: Frustration
description: Power is equal to the greater of ((255 - user's Happiness) * 2/5), rounded down, or 1.
shortDescription: Max 102 power at minimum Happiness.

name: Heal Bell
description: Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of its non-volatile status condition.
shortDescription: Cures the user's party of all status conditions.

name: High Jump Kick
description: If this attack is not successful and the target was not immune, the user loses HP equal to 1/8 the damage the target would have taken, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP, as crash damage.
shortDescription: If miss, user takes 1/8 damage it would've dealt.

name: Jump Kick
description: If this attack is not successful and the target was not immune, the user loses HP equal to 1/8 the damage the target would have taken, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP, as crash damage.
shortDescription: If miss, user takes 1/8 damage it would've dealt.

name: Karate Chop

name: Leech Seed

If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue being leeched. If the target switches out or uses Rapid Spin, the effect ends. Grass-type Pokemon are immune to this move on use, but not its effect.

name: Light Screen
description: For 5 turns, the user and its party members have their Special Defense doubled. Critical hits ignore this effect. Fails if the effect is already active on the user's side.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, the user's party has doubled Sp. Def.

name: Lock-On
description: The next accuracy check against the target succeeds. The target will still avoid Earthquake, Fissure, and Magnitude if it is using Fly. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement remains under this effect. This effect ends when the target leaves the field or an accuracy check is done against it.
shortDescription: The next move will not miss the target.

name: Low Kick
description: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Mean Look

The effect ends if the user leaves the field, unless it uses Baton Pass, in which case the target will remain trapped.

name: Metronome

name: Mimic

name: Mind Reader
description: The next accuracy check against the target succeeds. The target will still avoid Earthquake, Fissure, and Magnitude if it is using Fly. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement remains under this effect. This effect ends when the target leaves the field or an accuracy check is done against it.
shortDescription: The next move will not miss the target.

This move considers Hidden Power as Normal type, and only the last hit of a multi-hit attack is counted. Fails if the user moves first, if the user was not hit by a special attack this turn, or if the user did not lose HP from the attack.
shortDescription: If hit by special attack, returns double damage.

name: Mirror Move

name: Mist

name: Moonlight

shortDescription: Heals the user by a weather-dependent amount.

name: Morning Sun
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if no weather conditions are in effect, all of its HP if the weather is Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Rain Dance or Sandstorm, all rounded down.

name: Outrage

If the user is prevented from moving, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.

name: Pain Split
description: The user and the target's HP become the average of their current HP, rounded down, but not more than the maximum HP of either one.
shortDescription: Shares HP of user and target equally.

name: Perish Song
description: Each active Pokemon receives a perish count of 4 if it doesn't already have a perish count. At the end of each turn including the turn used, the perish count of all active Pokemon lowers by 1 and Pokemon faint if the number reaches 0. The perish count is removed from Pokemon that switch out. If a Pokemon uses Baton Pass while it has a perish count, the replacement will gain the perish count and continue to count down.
shortDescription: All active Pokemon will faint in 3 turns.

name: Petal Dance
description: Whether or not this move is successful, the user spends two or three turns locked into this move and becomes confused immediately after its move on the last turn of the effect, even if it is already confused. If the user is prevented from moving, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.

This move does not apply damage variance and cannot be a critical hit.
shortDescription: More power the less HP the user has left.

description: The user faints after using this move. The target's Defense is halved during damage calculation.
shortDescription: Target's Def halved during damage. User faints.

shortDescription: Raises user's Defense by 1 on turn 1. Hits turn 2.

shortDescription: Charges turn 1. Hits turn 2.

name: Slash
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio.

name: Sleep Talk

shortDescription: User must be asleep. Uses another known move.

name: Solar Beam

shortDescription: Charges turn 1. Hits turn 2. No charge in sunlight.

name: Spider Web

The effect ends if the user leaves the field, unless it uses Baton Pass, in which case the target will remain trapped.
shortDescription: Prevents the target from switching out.

name: Spikes
description: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, causing each opposing Pokemon that switches in to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP, rounded down, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon. Fails if the effect is already active on the opposing side. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin successfully.
shortDescription: Hurts grounded foes on switch-in. Max 1 layer.

name: Substitute
description: The user takes 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, and puts it into a substitute to take its place in battle. The substitute is removed once enough damage is inflicted on it, or if the user switches out or faints. Baton Pass can be used to transfer the substitute to an ally, and the substitute will keep its remaining HP. Until the substitute is broken, it receives damage from all attacks made by other Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat stage changes caused by other Pokemon. The user still takes normal damage from weather and status effects while behind its substitute. If the substitute breaks during a multi-hit attack, the user will take damage from any remaining hits. If a substitute is created while the user is trapped by a binding move, the binding effect ends immediately. Fails if the user does not have enough HP remaining to create a substitute without fainting, or if it already has a substitute.
shortDescription: User takes 1/4 its max HP to put in a substitute.

name: Swagger
description: Raises the target's Attack by 2 stages and confuses it. This move will miss if the target's Attack cannot be raised.

shortDescription: Heals the user by a weather-dependent amount.

name: Thief

shortDescription: If the user has no item, it steals the target's.

If the user is prevented from moving, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.
shortDescription: Lasts 2-3 turns. Confuses the user afterwards.

name: Crunch

If this move deals damage, it uses an abnormal version of the damage formula by substituting certain values. The user's Attack stat is replaced with 10 times the effectiveness of this move against the target, the target's Defense stat is replaced with the index number of the user's secondary type, and the user's level is replaced with the index number of the target's secondary type. If a Pokemon does not have a secondary type, its primary type is used. The index numbers for each type are Normal: 0, Fighting: 1, Flying: 2, Poison: 3, Ground: 4, Rock: 5, Bug: 7, Ghost: 8, Steel: 9, Fire: 20, Water: 21, Grass: 22, Electric: 23, Psychic: 24, Ice: 25, Dragon: 26, Dark: 27. If at any point a division by 0 would happen in the damage formula, it divides by 1 instead.

description: Deals typeless damage. Hits one time for each unfainted Pokemon without a non-volatile status condition in the user's party, or fails if no Pokemon meet the criteria. For each hit, the damage formula uses the participating Pokemon's base Attack as the Attack stat, the target's base Defense as the Defense stat, and ignores stat stages and other effects that modify Attack or Defense; each hit is considered to come from the user.

name: Bide
description: The user spends two turns locked into this move and then, on the second turn after using this move, the user attacks the last Pokemon that hit it, inflicting double the damage in HP it lost during the two turns. If the last Pokemon that hit it is no longer active, the user attacks a random opposing Pokemon instead. If the user is prevented from moving during this move's use, the effect ends. This move does not ignore type immunity.

name: Conversion

shortDescription: Changes user's type to match a known move.

name: Counter
description: Deals damage to the last opposing Pokemon to hit the user with a physical attack this turn equal to twice the HP lost by the user from that attack. If that opposing Pokemon's position is no longer in use and there is another opposing Pokemon on the field, the damage is done to it instead. This move considers Hidden Power as Normal type, and only the last hit of a multi-hit attack is counted. Fails if the user was not hit by an opposing Pokemon's physical attack this turn, or if the user did not lose HP from the attack.
shortDescription: If hit by physical attack, returns double damage.

name: Covet
description: If this attack was successful and the user has not fainted, it steals the target's held item if the user is not holding one. The target's item is not stolen if it is a Mail or Enigma Berry. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle.

name: Disable

Fails if this move or Future Sight is already in effect for the target's position.

name: Encore
description: For 3 to 6 turns, the target is forced to repeat its last move used. If the affected move runs out of PP, the effect ends. name: Fly
description: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Gust, Sky Uppercut, Thunder, and Twister, and Gust and Twister have doubled power when used against it.
shortDescription: Flies up on first turn, then strikes the next turn.

name: Follow Me
description: Until the end of the turn, all single-target attacks from the opposing side are redirected to the user. Such attacks are redirected to the user before they can be reflected by Magic Coat, or drawn in by the Lightning Rod Ability. This effect remains active even if the user leaves the field. Fails if it is not a Double Battle.
shortDescription: The foes' moves target the user on the turn used.

name: Foresight
description: As long as the target remains active, its evasiveness stat stage is ignored during accuracy checks against it, and Normal- and Fighting-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Ghost type.
shortDescription: Fighting, Normal hit Ghost. Evasiveness ignored.

name: Fury Cutter
description: Power doubles with each successful hit, up to a maximum of 160 power. The power is reset if this move misses or another move is used.
shortDescription: Power doubles with each hit, up to 160.

name: Giga Drain
description: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down.
shortDescription: User recovers 50% of the damage dealt.

name: Glare
description: Paralyzes the target. This move does not ignore type immunity.
shortDescription: Paralyzes the target.

name: Hidden Power
description: This move's type and power depend on the user's individual values (IVs). Power varies between 30 and 70, and type can be any but Normal.
shortDescription: Varies in power and type based on the user's IVs.

name: High Jump Kick
description: If this attack is not successful and the target was not immune, the user loses HP equal to half of the damage the target would have taken, rounded down, but no less than 1 HP and no more than half of the target's maximum HP, as crash damage.
shortDescription: If miss, user takes 1/2 damage it would've dealt.

name: Hypnosis
description: Causes the target to fall asleep.
shortDescription: Causes the target to fall asleep.

name: Jump Kick
description: If this attack is not successful and the target was not immune, the user loses HP equal to half of the damage the target would have taken, rounded down, but no less than 1 HP and no more than half of the target's maximum HP, as crash damage.
shortDescription: If miss, user takes 1/2 damage it would've dealt.

name: Leaf Blade
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio.

name: Lock-On
description: Until the end of the next turn, the target cannot avoid the user's moves, even if the target is in the middle of a two-turn move. When this effect is started against the target, this and Mind Reader's effects end for every other Pokemon against that target. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement remains under this effect. If the user leaves the field using Baton Pass, this effect is restarted against the same target for the replacement. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field.
shortDescription: User's next move will not miss the target.

name: Mega Drain
description: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down.
shortDescription: User recovers 50% of the damage dealt.

name: Memento
description: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages. The user faints. This move does not check accuracy, and can hit targets in the middle of a two-turn move. Fails entirely if the target's Attack and Special Attack stat stages are both -6.
shortDescription: Lowers target's Attack, Sp. Atk by 2. User faints.

name: Mind Reader
description: Until the end of the next turn, the target cannot avoid the user's moves, even if the target is in the middle of a two-turn move. When this effect is started against the target, this and Lock-On's effects end for every other Pokemon against that target. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement remains under this effect. If the user leaves the field using Baton Pass, this effect is restarted against the same target for the replacement. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field.
shortDescription: User's next move will not miss the target.

name: Mimic
description: While the user remains active, this move is replaced by the last move used by the target. The copied move has 5 PP. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the user has Transformed, if the user already knows the move, or if the move is Metronome, Mimic, Sketch, or Struggle.
shortDescription: The last move the target used replaces this one.

name: Mirror Coat
description: Deals damage to the last opposing Pokemon to hit the user with a special attack this turn equal to twice the HP lost by the user from that attack. If that opposing Pokemon's position is no longer in use and there is another opposing Pokemon on the field, the damage is done to it instead. This move considers Hidden Power as Normal type, and only the last hit of a multi-hit attack is counted. Fails if the user was not hit by an opposing Pokemon's special attack this turn, or if the user did not lose HP from the attack.
shortDescription: If hit by special attack, returns double damage.

name: Mirror Move
description: The user uses the last move that successfully targeted the user. The copied move is used with no specific target. Fails if no move has targeted the user, if the move missed, failed, or had no effect on the user, or if the move cannot be copied by this move.
shortDescription: User uses the target's last used move against it.

name: Nature Power
description: This move calls another move for use depending on the battle terrain. Swift in Wi-Fi battles.
shortDescription: Attack changes based on terrain. (Swift)

name: Needle Arm
description: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch. Damage doubles if the target has used Minimize while active.
shortDescription: 30% chance to make the target flinch.

name: Nightmare
description: Causes the target to lose 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn as long as it is asleep. This move does not affect the target unless it is asleep. The effect ends when the target wakes up, even if it falls asleep again in the same turn.
shortDescription: A sleeping target is hurt by 1/4 max HP per turn.

name: Odor Sleuth
description: As long as the target remains active, its evasiveness stat stage is ignored during accuracy checks against it, and Normal- and Fighting-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Ghost type.
shortDescription: Fighting, Normal hit Ghost. Evasiveness ignored.

name: Outrage
description: The user spends two or three turns locked into this move and becomes confused at the end of the last turn of the effect if it is not already. This move targets an opposing Pokemon at random on each turn. If the user is prevented from moving, falls asleep, becomes frozen, or the attack is not successful against the target, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.
shortDescription: Lasts 2-3 turns. Confuses the user afterwards.

name: Overheat
description: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Lowers the user's Sp. Atk by 2.

name: Petal Dance
description: The user spends two or three turns locked into this move and becomes confused at the end of the last turn of the effect if it is not already. This move targets an opposing Pokemon at random on each turn. If the user is prevented from moving, falls asleep, becomes frozen, or the attack is not successful against the target, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.
shortDescription: Lasts 2-3 turns. Confuses the user afterwards.

name: Recover
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down.
shortDescription: Heals the user by 50% of its max HP.

name: Reversal
description: The power of this move is 20 if X is 33 to 48, 40 if X is 17 to 32, 80 if X is 10 to 16, 100 if X is 5 to 9, 150 if X is 2 to 4, and 200 if X is 0 or 1, where X is equal to (user's current HP * 48 / user's maximum HP), rounded down.
shortDescription: More power the less HP the user has left.

name: Rock Smash
description: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

name: Sketch
description: This move is permanently replaced by the last move used by the target. The copied move has the maximum PP for that move. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the user has Transformed, or if the move is Sketch, Struggle, or any move the user knows.
shortDescription: Permanently copies the last move target used.

name: Sleep Talk
description: One of the user's known moves, besides this move, is selected for use at random. Fails if the user is not asleep. The selected move does not have PP deducted from it, but if it currently has 0 PP it will fail to be used. This move cannot select Assist, Bide, Focus Punch, Metronome, Mirror Move, Sleep Talk, Uproar, or any two-turn move.
shortDescription: User must be asleep. Uses another known move.

name: Spite
description: Causes the target's last move used to lose 2 to 5 PP, at random. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the move has 0 or 1 PP, or if it no longer knows the move.
shortDescription: Lowers the PP of the target's last move by 2-5.

name: Stockpile
description: The user's Stockpile count increases by 1. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 3. The user's Stockpile count is reset to 0 when it is no longer active.
shortDescription: Raises user's Stockpile count by 1. Max 3 uses.

name: Struggle
description: Deals typeless damage to a random opposing Pokemon. If this move was successful, the user takes damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP, and the Rock Head Ability does not prevent this. This move is automatically used if none of the user's known moves can be selected.
shortDescription: User loses 1/4 the HP lost by the target.

name: Surf
description: Power doubles if the target is using Dive.
shortDescription: Hits foes. Power doubles against Dive.

name: Taunt
description: For 2 turns, prevents the target from using non-damaging moves.
shortDescription: For 2 turns, the target can't use status moves.

name: Teeter Dance
description: Causes the target to become confused.
shortDescription: Confuses adjacent Pokemon.

name: Tickle
description: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1.

name: Uproar
description: The user spends two to five turns locked into this move. This move targets an opposing Pokemon at random on each turn. During effect, no active Pokemon can fall asleep by any means, and Pokemon that are already asleep wake up as their turn starts or at the end of each turn, including the last one. If the user is prevented from moving or the attack is not successful against the target during one of the turns, the effect ends.
shortDescription: Lasts 2-5 turns. Active Pokemon cannot sleep.

name: Vine Whip
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Volt Tackle
description: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/3 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Has 1/3 recoil.

name: Waterfall
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Weather Ball
description: Damage doubles if a weather condition is active, and this move's type changes to match. Ice type during Hail, Water type during Rain Dance, Rock type during Sandstorm, and Fire type during Sunny Day.
shortDescription: Damage doubles and type varies during weather.

name: Zap Cannon
description: Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.
shortDescription: 100% chance to paralyze the target.

name: Aromatherapy
description: Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of its non-volatile status condition.
shortDescription: Cures the user's party of all status conditions.

name: Bind
description: Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns. Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
shortDescription: Traps and damages the target for 2-5 turns.

name: Bone Rush
description: Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits.
shortDescription: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Bullet Seed
description: Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits.
shortDescription: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Camouflage
description: The user's type changes based on the battle terrain. Normal type on the regular Wi-Fi terrain. Fails if the type is one of the user's current types.
shortDescription: Changes user's type based on terrain. (Normal)

name: Clamp
description: Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns. Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
shortDescription: Traps and damages the target for 2-5 turns.

name: Cotton Spore
description: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Lowers the target's Speed by 2.

name: Crabhammer
description: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.
shortDescription: High critical hit ratio.

name: Curse
description: If the user is not a Ghost type, lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage and raises the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage. If the user is a Ghost type, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down and even if it would cause fainting, in exchange for the target losing 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn while it is active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue to be affected. Fails if there is no target or if the target is already affected or has a substitute.
shortDescription: Curses if Ghost, else -1 Spe, +1 Atk, +1 Def.

name: Detect
description: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn. This move has an X/65536 chance of being successful, where X starts at 65535 and halves, rounded down, each time this move is successfully used. After the fourth successful use in a row, X drops to 118 and continues with seemingly random values from 0-65535 on subsequent successful uses. X resets to 65535 if this move fails or if the user's last move used is not Detect, Endure, or Protect. Fails if the user moves last this turn.
shortDescription: Prevents moves from affecting the user this turn.

name: Double-Edge
description: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/3 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: Has 1/3 recoil.

name: Dream Eater
description: The target is unaffected by this move unless it is asleep and does not have a substitute. The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.
shortDescription: User gains 1/2 HP inflicted. Sleeping target only.

name: Endeavor
description: Deals damage to the target equal to (target's current HP - user's current HP). The target is unaffected if its current HP is less than or equal to the user's current HP.
shortDescription: Lowers the target's HP to the user's HP.

name: Extreme Speed
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: Usually goes first.

name: Fire Spin
description: Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns. Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
shortDescription: Traps and damages the target for 2-5 turns.

name: Focus Punch
description: The user loses its focus and does nothing if it is hit by a damaging attack this turn before it can execute the move, but it still loses PP.
shortDescription: Fails if the user takes damage before it hits.

name: Future Sight
description: Deals typeless damage that cannot be a critical hit two turns after this move is used. Damage is calculated against the target on use, and at the end of the final turn that damage is dealt to the Pokemon at the position the original target had at the time. Fails if this move or Doom Desire is already in effect for the target's position.
shortDescription: Hits two turns after being used.

name: Growth
description: Raises the user's Special Attack by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Raises the user's Sp. Atk by 1.

name: Heal Bell
description: Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of its non-volatile status condition. Pokemon with the Soundproof Ability are not cured.
shortDescription: Cures the user's party of all status conditions.

name: Icicle Spear
description: Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits.
shortDescription: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Imprison
description: The user prevents all opposing Pokemon from using any moves that the user also knows as long as the user remains active. Fails if no opposing Pokemon know any of the user's moves.
shortDescription: No foe can use any move known by the user.

name: Ingrain
description: The user has 1/16 of its maximum HP restored at the end of each turn, but it is prevented from switching out and other Pokemon cannot force the user to switch out. The user can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass, and the replacement will remain trapped and still receive the healing effect.
shortDescription: User recovers 1/16 max HP per turn. Traps user.

name: Knock Off
description: The target's held item is lost for the rest of the battle, unless it has the Sticky Hold Ability. During the effect, the target cannot gain a new item by any means.
shortDescription: Target's item is lost and it cannot obtain another.

name: Leech Seed
description: The Pokemon at the user's position steals 1/8 of the target's maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue being leeched. If the target switches out or uses Rapid Spin, the effect ends. Grass-type Pokemon are immune to this move on use, but not its effect.
shortDescription: 1/8 of target's HP is restored to user every turn.

name: Light Screen
description: For 5 turns, the user and its party members take 1/2 damage from special attacks, or 2/3 damage if there are multiple active Pokemon on the user's side. Critical hits ignore this effect. It is removed from the user's side if the user or an ally is successfully hit by Brick Break. Fails if the effect is already active on the user's side.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, special damage to allies is halved.

name: Magic Coat
description: The user is unaffected by certain non-damaging moves directed at it and will instead use such moves against the original user. If the move targets both opposing Pokemon and the Pokemon under this effect is on the left side, it will reflect the move targeting both opposing Pokemon and its ally will not be affected by the original move; otherwise, if the Pokemon under this effect is on the right side, its ally will be affected by the original move and this Pokemon will reflect the move only targeting the original user. The effect ends once a move is reflected or at the end of the turn. Moves reflected in this way can be reflected again by another Pokemon under this effect. If the user has the Soundproof Ability, it nullifies sound-based moves before this effect happens. The Lightning Rod Ability redirects Electric moves before this move takes effect.
shortDescription: Bounces back certain non-damaging moves.

name: Metronome
description: A random move is selected for use, other than Counter, Covet, Destiny Bond, Detect, Endure, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Helping Hand, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Coat, Protect, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Snatch, Struggle, Thief, or Trick.
shortDescription: Picks a random move.

name: Minimize
description: Raises the user's evasiveness by 1 stage. Whether or not the user's evasiveness was changed, Astonish, Extrasensory, Needle Arm, and Stomp will have their damage doubled if used against the user while it is active.
shortDescription: Raises the user's evasiveness by 1.

name: Mist
description: For 5 turns, the user and its party members are protected from having their stat stages lowered by other Pokemon. Fails if the effect is already active on the user's side.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, protects user's party from stat drops.

name: Moonlight
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if no weather conditions are in effect, 2/3 of its maximum HP if the weather is Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Hail, Rain Dance, or Sandstorm, all rounded down.
shortDescription: Heals the user by a weather-dependent amount.

name: Morning Sun
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if no weather conditions are in effect, 2/3 of its maximum HP if the weather is Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Hail, Rain Dance, or Sandstorm, all rounded down.
shortDescription: Heals the user by a weather-dependent amount.

name: Mud Sport
description: While the user is active, all Electric-type attacks used by any active Pokemon have their power halved. Fails if this effect is already active for the user. Baton Pass can be used to transfer this effect to an ally.
shortDescription: Weakens Electric-type attacks to 1/2 their power.

name: Pay Day
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: Scatters coins.

name: Perish Song
description: Each active Pokemon receives a perish count of 4 if it doesn't already have a perish count. At the end of each turn including the turn used, the perish count of all active Pokemon lowers by 1 and Pokemon faint if the number reaches 0. The perish count is removed from Pokemon that switch out. If a Pokemon uses Baton Pass while it has a perish count, the replacement will gain the perish count and continue to count down.
shortDescription: All active Pokemon will faint in 3 turns.

name: Poison Gas
description: Poisons the target.
shortDescription: Poisons the foe(s).

name: Protect
description: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn. This move has an X/65536 chance of being successful, where X starts at 65535 and halves, rounded down, each time this move is successfully used. After the fourth successful use in a row, X drops to 118 and continues with seemingly random values from 0-65535 on subsequent successful uses. X resets to 65535 if this move fails or if the user's last move used is not Detect, Endure, or Protect. Fails if the user moves last this turn.
shortDescription: Prevents moves from affecting the user this turn.

name: Psych Up
description: The user copies all of the target's current stat stage changes.
shortDescription: Copies the target's current stat stages.

name: Pursuit
description: If the target is an opposing Pokemon and it switches out this turn, this move hits that Pokemon before it leaves the field. Power doubles and no accuracy check is done if the user hits an opponent switching out, and the user's turn is over; if an opponent faints from this, the replacement Pokemon becomes active immediately.
shortDescription: Power doubles if the targeted foe is switching out.

name: Rapid Spin
description: If this move is successful, the effects of Leech Seed and binding moves end for the user, and Spikes are removed from the user's side of the field.
shortDescription: Frees user from hazards, binding, Leech Seed.

name: Recycle
description: The user regains the item last used by a Pokemon in its current position on the field, even if that Pokemon was not the user. Fails if the user is holding an item, if no items have been used at the user's position, or if the item was lost to Covet, Knock Off, or Thief. Items thrown with Fling can be regained.
shortDescription: Restores the item the user last used.

name: Reflect
description: For 5 turns, the user and its party members take 1/2 damage from physical attacks, or 2/3 damage if there are multiple active Pokemon on the user's side. Critical hits ignore this effect. It is removed from the user's side if the user or an ally is successfully hit by Brick Break. Fails if the effect is already active on the user's side.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, physical damage to allies is halved.

name: Roar
description: The target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. Fails if the target is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party, if the target used Ingrain previously or has the Suction Cups Ability, or if the user's level is lower than the target's and X * (user's level + target's level) / 256 + 1 is less than or equal to (target's level / 4), rounded down, where X is a random number from 0 to 255.
shortDescription: Forces the target to switch to a random ally.

name: Rock Blast
description: Hits two to five times. Has a 3/8 chance to hit two or three times, and a 1/8 chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits.
shortDescription: Hits 2-5 times in one turn.

name: Role Play
description: The user's Ability changes to match the target's Ability. Fails if the target's Ability is Wonder Guard.
shortDescription: User replaces its Ability with the target's.

name: Safeguard
description: For 5 turns, the user and its party members cannot have non-volatile status conditions or confusion inflicted on them by other Pokemon. Pokemon on the user's side cannot become affected by Yawn but can fall asleep from its effect. Fails if the effect is already active on the user's side.
shortDescription: For 5 turns, protects user's party from status.

name: Sand Tomb
description: Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns. Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
shortDescription: Traps and damages the target for 2-5 turns.

name: Scary Face
description: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Lowers the target's Speed by 2.

name: Secret Power
description: Has a 30% chance to cause a secondary effect on the target based on the battle terrain. Causes paralysis on the regular Wi-Fi terrain.
shortDescription: Effect varies with terrain. (30% paralysis chance)

name: Skill Swap
description: The user swaps its Ability with the target's Ability. Fails if either the user or the target's Ability is Wonder Guard.
shortDescription: The user and the target trade Abilities.

name: Snatch
description: If another Pokemon uses certain non-damaging moves this turn, the user steals that move to use itself. If multiple Pokemon use this move this turn, the applicable moves are stolen by each of those Pokemon in turn order, and only the last user in turn order will gain the effects.
shortDescription: User steals certain support moves to use itself.

name: Snore
description: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch. Fails if the user is not asleep.
shortDescription: User must be asleep. 30% chance to flinch target.

name: Spikes
description: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Can be used up to three times before failing. Opponents lose 1/8 of their maximum HP with one layer, 1/6 of their maximum HP with two layers, and 1/4 of their maximum HP with three layers, all rounded down. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Rapid Spin successfully.
shortDescription: Hurts grounded foes on switch-in. Max 3 layers.

name: Substitute
description: The user takes 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, and puts it into a substitute to take its place in battle. The substitute is removed once enough damage is inflicted on it, or if the user switches out or faints. Baton Pass can be used to transfer the substitute to an ally, and the substitute will keep its remaining HP. Until the substitute is broken, it receives damage from all attacks made by other Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat stage changes caused by other Pokemon. The user still takes normal damage from weather and status effects while behind its substitute. If the substitute breaks during a multi-hit attack, the user will take damage from any remaining hits. If a substitute is created while the user is trapped by a binding move, the binding effect ends immediately. Fails if the user does not have enough HP remaining to create a substitute without fainting, or if it already has a substitute.
shortDescription: User takes 1/4 its max HP to put in a substitute.

name: Swallow
description: The user restores its HP based on its Stockpile count. Restores 1/4 of its maximum HP if it's 1, 1/2 of its maximum HP if it's 2, both rounded half down, and all of its HP if it's 3. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 0. The user's Stockpile count resets to 0.
shortDescription: Heals the user based on uses of Stockpile.

name: Synthesis
description: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if no weather conditions are in effect, 2/3 of its maximum HP if the weather is Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Hail, Rain Dance, or Sandstorm, all rounded down.
shortDescription: Heals the user by a weather-dependent amount.

name: Tackle
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: No additional effect.

name: Tail Glow
description: Raises the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Raises the user's Sp. Atk by 2.

name: Thrash
description: The user spends two or three turns locked into this move and becomes confused at the end of the last turn of the effect if it is not already. This move targets an opposing Pokemon at random on each turn. If the user is prevented from moving, falls asleep, becomes frozen, or the attack is not successful against the target, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.
shortDescription: Lasts 2-3 turns. Confuses the user afterwards.

name: Torment
description: Prevents the target from selecting the same move for use two turns in a row. This effect ends when the target is no longer active.
shortDescription: Target can't select the same move twice in a row.

name: Toxic
description: Badly poisons the target.
shortDescription: Badly poisons the target.

name: Transform
description: The user transforms into the target. The target's current stats, stat stages, types, moves, Ability, weight, IVs, species, and sprite are copied. The user's level and HP remain the same and each copied move receives only 5 PP. This move fails if the target has transformed.
shortDescription: Copies target's stats, moves, types, and Ability.

name: Trick
description: The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail, if neither is holding an item, if either is under the effect of Knock Off, or if the target has the Sticky Hold Ability.
shortDescription: User switches its held item with the target's.

name: Water Sport
description: While the user is active, all Fire-type attacks used by any active Pokemon have their power halved. Fails if this effect is already active for the user. Baton Pass can be used to transfer this effect to an ally.
shortDescription: Weakens Fire-type attacks to 1/2 their power.

name: Whirlpool
description: Prevents the target from switching for two to five turns. Causes damage to the target equal to 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it uses Baton Pass. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Rapid Spin or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.
shortDescription: Traps and damages the target for 2-5 turns.

name: Whirlwind
description: The target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. Fails if the target is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party, if the target used Ingrain previously or has the Suction Cups Ability, or if the user's level is lower than the target's and X * (user's level + target's level) / 256 + 1 is less than or equal to (target's level / 4), rounded down, where X is a random number from 0 to 255.
shortDescription: Forces the target to switch to a random ally.

name: Wish
description: At the end of the next turn, the Pokemon at the user's position has 1/2 of its maximum HP restored to it, rounded down. Fails if this move is already in effect for the user's position.
shortDescription: Next turn, heals 50% of the recipient's max HP.

name: Wrap

This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

If the target becomes affected, this effect cannot be prevented by Safeguard or a substitute, or by falling asleep and waking up during the effect.

shortDescription: 100% chance to lower the foe(s) Speed by 1.

name: Iron Defense
description: Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.
shortDescription: Raises the user's Defense by 2.

name: Iron Tail
description: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1.

name: Leer
description: Lowers the target's Defense by 1 stage.
shortDescription: Lowers the foe(s) Defense by 1.

name: Mach Punch
description: No additional effect.
shortDescription: Usually goes first.
